sentences.english: His voice still stood with courage.
sentences.chinese: 他的语音依然是那么勇敢坚定。

sentences.english: True extremely not easily Huan Yao brave the life disturbances facing.
sentences.chinese: 人生的风风雨雨真的很不容易还要勇敢的面对。

sentences.english: He won many hearts by his gallantry.
sentences.chinese: 他以勇敢赢得芳心无数。

sentences.english: Some called the artist brave and hardworking.
sentences.chinese: 有些所谓的艺术家勤劳勇敢的。

sentences.english: I think Sohu is brave to do this.
sentences.chinese: 我认为搜狐在这点上很勇敢。

sentences.english: In my view, a masculine man should be generous and brave as a feminine woman tender and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 男人味就是豁达勇敢，女人味就是温柔体贴。

sentences.english: It's a gutsy move to wear ugly clothes.'
sentences.chinese: 穿丑服装是个勇敢的举动。

sentences.english: As for Mahmood, he became more courageous from that day onward.
sentences.chinese: 至于马哈茂德，从那一天起他变得更加勇敢了。

sentences.english: The brave young man voyaged single-handed in his yacht for months.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的年轻人独自乘游艇航行数月。

sentences.english: We need courage, need more wisdom, indifferent face, to be sincere.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要勇敢，更需要智慧，淡然面对，真诚以待。

sentences.english: Seed your tears deep in your heart it will grow up to valorous flowers.
sentences.chinese: 把眼泪种在心里，会开出勇敢的花朵。
罗西茨基倾向他的头勇敢。

sentences.english: The airman bold ly jump from the airplane with his parachute.
sentences.chinese: 飞行员带着降落伞勇敢地跳下飞机。

sentences.english: But thou wast ever bravely meek.
sentences.chinese: 但你虽一向温和却很勇敢。

definition: to dare to/to be brave enough to
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
daring to act and courageous enough to take responsibility for it/a true man has the courage to accept the consequences of his actions/the buck stops here
